intro: Cayaponia trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three distinct lobes and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
